title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 is defined in Section 1. Section 2 provides definitions. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges as defined in section 2 of the Tribally Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978. The term "tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions" is defined in section 390(2) of the Tribally Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990 (20 U.S.C. 2397h). Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions have SEC. 3 land grant status. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions, such as the Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College, are considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. The applicability of related provisions of any Act of Congress relating to the operation or provision of assistance to a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, or the District of. The provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, relating to donations of public land for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts apply to land-grant colleges and institutions in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern Mariana Islands. Authorization of appropriations. In lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land scrip for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts, there is authorized to be appropriated $10,000,000 to such. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be held and considered to have been granted to such colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land scrip. The Act is titled the "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993". It defines the term "land-grant status". The "1994 Institutions" referred to in the Act include various colleges such as Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, and others. The Act includes Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts. They are subject to provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges, with exceptions for agricultural research funding under specific Acts. In lieu of extending provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, $23,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated to 1994 Institutions for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts. Amounts granted are subject to provisions applicable to proceeds from land sales. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 and the Act of May 8, 1914 are amended to include provisions for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on fund allocation. The Act of August 30, 1890 and the Act of May 8, 1914 are amended to include provisions for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on fund allocation. In subsection (b) of 7 U.S.C. 343, $5,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated annually for payment on behalf of the 1994 Institutions, distributed through a competitive applications process developed by the Secretary. In subsection (b) of 7 U.S.C. 343, $5,000,000 is authorized annually for 1994 Institutions without a matching requirement. SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. $1,700,000 is authorized for grants for fiscal years 1995 through 1999. In 1999, $1,700,000 is authorized for grants to 1994 Institutions for specified purposes. Amend the title to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
